name: market for coffee maker | coffee maker | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21414/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'coffee maker', in the Global geography.;Transport information are taken from the ecoinvent GLO transport model, excel accessible on the ecoinvent website "Default Transport Assumptions". Air transport is excluded based on expert judgement.;This is a mobile infrastructure, representing the product of a coffee maker that is used to produce coffe. It has a mass of 1.9 kg and a rating of 640 W, while its lifetime is estimated to be 5 years and its lifetime capacity 2129.16 hours. Its production represents all materials necessary to construct it, energy consumption during manufacturing and its end-of-life.

The activity starts at factory gate with the final product ready for transport (packaging is not included).

The activity includes the transport of the final good to the consumer.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/275:Manufacture of domestic appliances/2750:Manufacture of domestic appliances

Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.

exchanges.description:
The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions of transport by rail and inland waterways.
The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010.
